Detailed Description

A Gas from an atmosphere.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

SG_Gas::SG_Gas (  int  AtomicNumber,
SG_String  Symbol,
long double  AtomicWeight,
long double  MeltPoint,
long double  BoilingPoint,
long double  Density,
long double  Abunds,
long double  Reactivity,
long double  Toxicity,
SG_String  Name
) 
 

Constructor.

Parameters:
AtomicNumber The atomic number is the number of protons found in the nucleus of the atom. (ID key)
Symbol The chemical symbol of the gas.
AtomicWeight The atomic weigth is the average atomic mass of the chemical element.
MeltPoint The Melting temperature of the element at 1 bar (unit = Kelvin)
BoilingPoint The Boiling temperature of the element at 1 bar (unit = Kelvin)
Density The gas density of the element (unit = gram/cc)
Abunds The Aboundance of the element on the Solar System (unit = ??).
Reactivity This indicate how fast the gas will disapear with time (0 = no loss)
Toxicity Above this limit, the gas reaches a toxic ratio (unit = ppm).
Name The full name of the gas.

long double SG_Gas::getAbound (   ) 
 

This function returns the aboundance of the Gas in the Sun.

Returns:
the solar aboundance of the Gas.

long double SG_Gas::getBoilingPoint (  long double  pressure  ) 
 

This function returns the Boiling Temperature of this gas, under a given pressure.

The Boiling Point is the transition between a liquid state and a gas state.

Parameters:
pressure The pressure submitted to the gas. (Units = mB)
Returns:
The Boiling point of the gaz (Units = K)

long double SG_Gas::getFract (  long double  Molec_weight  ) 
 

Faction of the gas depending on the atomic mass.

The more the atomic mass of the gas is close of the minimum atomic mass retained on the planet, the more the fraction will be close to 0. On the other side, the more the gas is heavy, the more the fraction will be close to 1, and the more the gas will be kept on the planet.

SG_Gas::SG_colour SG_Gas::getGasColour (   ) 
 

This function returns the colour of this gas.

Returns:
The colour and transparency of the gas. /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------

long double SG_Gas::getInspiredPartialPressure (  long double  surf_pressure  ) 
 

This function determine if the gas can be breathed by a human.

Taking into account humidification of the air in the nasal passage and throat. This formula is on Dole's p. 14

Parameters:
surf_pressure The pressure at the surface of the planet
Returns:
The inspired partial pressure.

long double SG_Gas::getMaxIPP (   ) 
 

This function returns the Maximal Inspired Partial Pressure of the gas.

Above this partial pressure, the gas reaches a toxic level.

long double SG_Gas::getMeltingPoint (  long double  pressure  ) 
 

This function returns the Melting Temperature of this gas, under a given pressure.

The Boiling Point is the transition between a solid state and a liquid state.

Parameters:
pressure The pressure submitted to the gas. (Units = mB)
Returns:
The Melting Point of the gaz (Units = K)

Note: we consider here that the Melt Point is the same for all pressure. A better calculation can be done.

This function returns the percentage of the gas in the atmosphere.

Returns:
The percentage is a value in [0..1]. /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------

long double SG_Gas::getPVRMS (  long double  temperature,
long double  Escape_velocity,
long double  years
) 
 

This function returns the ratio of the gas kept by the planet gravity and temperature.

This function calculate the ratio of gas escaped from the planet, due to a RMSvelocity exceeding the Escape Velocity of the planet.

Parameters:
temperature The temperature submitted to the gas (unit = Kelvin)
Escape_velocity The Escape velocity of the planet (unit = cm/s)
years The elapsed time (unit = years)
Returns:
The ratio of gas remaining.

long double SG_Gas::getReact (  long double  temperature,
long double  pressure,
long double  years
) 
 

This function calculate how the gas will slowly diseapear under some atmospheric conditions.

Parameters:
temperature The temperature submitted to the gas
pressure The pressure submitted to the gas (unit = mB)
years The elapsed time (unit = years)
Returns:
The remaining fraction of the gas.
See also:
getPres2

long double SG_Gas::getRMSvelocity (  long double  temperature  )  [protected]
 

This function return the RMS velocity of a gas, under a certain temperature.

This is Fogg's eq.16. The molecular weight (usually assumed to be N2) is used as the basis of the Root Mean Square (RMS) velocity of the molecule or atom.

Parameters:
temperature The Temperature submitted to the gas.
Returns:
The RMS velocity of the gas molecules (Units = cm/sec)

)
